author: mariohavel
content: I would consider it immoral to demand people to run a proprietary software to be able participate in EPF. The program should also teach importance of free software and Jitsi is a great example of open tool maintained by community achieving better outcome than their corporate counterparts. That being said, no platform is without problems and even Zoom always gives me troubles, not mentioning the inferior user experience. We are using EF Jitsi server and devops team didn't prioritize its maintenance which also caused some issues :/

author: potuz
content: I appreciate the preference for open sourced alternatives, but to actually be an alternative the software has to work. During the first two cohorts I simply couldn't hear any audio a single time after trying on many different browsers. This last cohort I did manage to log in correctly once on chrome. I'm definitely not alone on this issue since this has been a recurrent one in every single cohort
